items.title: Coffee Prices Soar Over 100%, Near Historic Rally As Inflation Percolates Through Supply Chain
items.author: Piero Cingari
items.description: Coffee prices have surged to record highs, surpassing levels last seen in 1977, due to supply chain issues and climate change. This threatens to increase the cost of a cup of coffee significantly, impacting businesses across the industry.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: McDonald's core customer base is highly price-sensitive, and the company might have less flexibility to raise coffee prices without impacting sales.
Starbucks has a loyal customer base and a premium brand, which might allow it to raise prices without losing customers, positioning it as a price setter in the coffee market.
The stock's performance suggests concerns over Restaurant Brands International's ability to manage higher input costs, as it owns the Tim Hortons coffee chain.
